templates.content: Since rewards points act as a promo code, you cannot combine both in the same order. templates.name: What's the difference between mass market and soft cover books?
templates.content: The difference between mass-market and softcover books is that softcover books are larger, higher quality, and most expensive. In contrast, mass-market paperbacks are smaller, with less durability but a lower price.

templates.name: Bible Warranty and Replacement
templates.content: Our manufacturer's warranty provides coverage for defective bindings on hardcover, softcover, and Leather-LookTM and Italian Duo-Tone Bibles for four years and on bonded and top-grain leather Bibles for six years. This warranty doesn't apply to normal wear and tear. A lifetime warranty applies to defects within Bibles and books like missing pages, chapters, or books, collating errors and pages bound upside down. If your Bible meets these criteria, we'll replace it for you. You can find further instructions on how to request a replacement here: https://www.harpercollinschristian.com/p/2020/06/30/bible-warranty-and-replacement/

templates.name: What is Glose?
templates.content: Glose is a next-generation eBook and audiobook experience. Glose is a website (www.glose.com) and a free mobile application for iOS and Android that allows you to read eBooks and/or listen to audiobooks purchased from us, https://churchsource.com/ After purchasing from our site, your eBook or audiobook will be available to read or listen through your computer on www.glose.com as well as from your smartphone or tablet through the Glose app. Please visit www.glose.com to learn more.

templates.name: How can I read the books I purchase or eBooks?
templates.content:
You can read your ebook purchase in the free Glose app by downloading it to any compatible Apple or Android device from your Apple App or Google Play Store or by going to glose.com
 
 1. Launch the app or visit glose.com, and from the menu select Log In
 2. Select Other Sign In Options
 3. Select HarperCollins
 4. Enter the UserName and Password you used to purchase your eBook
 5. Select the book you would like to read and chose Read or Resume
 
Here is a video example: https://churchsource.attn.tv/aix8xyn-LrRb

templates.name: How can I get my order tax exempt?
templates.content: For Tax Exemption a copy of your State Sales Tax Exemption Certificate [not the same as a 501(c)(3) certificate] must be filed with ChurchSource prior to placing your order. If you already have an approved certificate on file, the tax will drop off when the order is processed. If you do not have one on file, you can send us a copy to be placed on file.
